intro: Rhyncholepis roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in temperate to subtropical climates and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations. Rhyncholepis roxburghii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
